question: Every night when I close my eyes the dreams come. That's how the dead talk to us, I guess. In the dark, when our souls are off wandering... I just wish I understood what they were telling me. Hey, Gabriel... reaches the shower, strips off her clothes. Her back and upper arms are decorated with graceful tattoo work - a pair of black angel wings sweeping over her shoulder blades. She's got a ring in her navel, another in a nipple... Gotta name?
answer: Grace. So what?

question: Listen, Grace, how does some hot coffee sound? Maybe a little food?
answer: What do you want?

question: Almost finished. Doing okay? That's why they call me the Mistress of Pain.
answer: What a downer - this kid wanted me to tattoo "If you're reading this, you're too close" on his bleedin' bum! Christ, I'm knackered.

question: Beats pushing ink in Detroit.
answer: That it does, Princess, that it does. They do 'em for the Day of the Dead. Want to grab a beer, then?

question: No, I gotta go home. Haven't been sleeping much lately.
answer: So, what's the dirty dog's name?

question: You think what you did to me is funny? Some kind of joke?
answer: What are you talking about?!

question: I'm talking about the fucking tattoo you gave me! I took off the bandages. Look...!!!
answer: A crow...

question: Then what-the-fuck is it doing there?!
answer: I don't know, I was just going from the design you gave me...

question: What's it going to be, hero? Ready to kiss your faggot-ass good-bye? I think so. I think you're shitting yourself you're so goddamn ready.
answer: Over here, ass-hole...

question: Agh!!! SHIT!!!
answer: Get up.

question: Shoulda killed me while you had the chance, sugarplum. Be seeing you.
answer: You okay?

question: You okay?
answer: Fuck me, wonder what they'll be snorting next?

question: I just can't do this anymore... I'm so tired of this.
answer: Easy there, luv. It'll all work out.

question: Spider Monkey, what's this tattoo look like to you?
answer: This a test?

question: Come on, man, just tell me what you see.
answer: A bird. Nope. I see a bird.

question: digs his fingers into the wood-rot pulp of the pilings and claws his way up to the jetty. He collapses down onto the wooded slats. crouches before us, his face hidden from view. He reaches out his hand, touching an unmistakable BLOOD STAIN... Danny's blood stain. This triggers more painful memories...
answer: emerges from the shadows, staring down at Ashe in wonder. sits on the other side of the loft in a paint-smeared work-shirt, brush in hand. She's studying a half-finished canvas, contemplating her next move. My name's Sarah. I had a dream about you. I saw them shoot you and your son...

question: How did I survive?
answer: You're dead.

question: No... Stop looking at me that way -- stop looking -- this isn't real, none of this is real! I'm dreaming this.
answer: Hey, Dad...what color should I make the sun?

question: Blue.
answer: There's no such thing.

question: NO!!!
answer: stands in the doorway.

question: Why are you here?
answer: I don't know. I want to help you. I need to.

question: Everything's so confused...
answer: He's not here anymore.

question: There's no moon...
answer: You've been given another chance, Ashe -- to put the wrong things right... I believe there've always been people like you... It's the pain that brings people back. It makes us strong again.

question: Ono!
answer: 'My mother was accursed the night she bore me and I am faint with envy of all the dead'. Tell me, Monkey. Does the corpse have a familiar face?

question: Who the fuck are you?
answer: You have to learn to look beyond the mask.

question: No way, man...we put you under...you and that little snot-nosed kid...
answer: Looking for this? springs from the ground, SLAMMING Spider Monkey against a table of chemicals. Bottles SHATTER on the floor, spilling their toxic contents.

question: What are you?! What the fuck are you?!
answer: I wasn't sure at first. Now I know. I'm the boiling man, Monkey. I'm the plague of Darkness and the death of the first-born. All your nightmares rolled into one.

question: Whoa...this shit's flammable! Look, look, what do you want?
answer: The others. Who are they?

question: Nemo. Kali. Judah. And Curve.
answer: I'll start with Nemo, then work my way up the food chain. Where is he?

question: Nemo? Nemo's an old gash-hound. He hangs out at the Peep-O-Rama on Deacon Street!
answer: Congratulations, monkey. You just bought yourself a fighting chance. Pick a card, monkey. Lady Luck's a bitch.

question: Aw, Jesus, c'mon, man!
answer: You're wasting your breath, angelito. Nobody's up there listening.

question: lounging on a couch a few dozen yards away, watching the women on four video monitors, detached and twice removed from the sex play.
answer: enters from out of the shadows. Judah looks up to him. Bad news.

question: Illuminate me.
answer: Someone torched the lab on Manchester. Spider Monkey's a fucking crispy critter.

question: Monkey I could care less about. What about our merchandise?
answer: A total loss.

question: You got a name? I need to see some sugar. Right on, sister... Yeah, we're gonna celebrate Christmas a little early this year. Shitfire... Come on, fucker!
answer: is standing on the other side of the Plexiglas. His mouth splits into an evil grin. "Do you want me, baby?"

question: You.
answer: Me. One crow sorrow... ...two crows joy... Three crows a letter, four crows a boy... Five crows silver, six crows gold... Seven crows a secret never to be told.

question: ...please, please just stop...
answer: You killed my son, Nemo. You took away the only piece of light left in my soul.

question: We had to! Judah's orders. Never leave any witnesses! We didn't have a choice!
answer: We always have a choice. If you value what you've lost, you'll walk away from this place and never look back.

question: Can I help you?
answer: I'm sorry, Father, I was just watching...

question: Our doors are open.
answer: What is this for?

question: Dias de los Muertos, the Days of the Dead. We light the candles for our loved ones - so that they might find their way back to earth and share in the pleasures of the living. Tomorrow night we will celebrate. The people will dance, sing...
answer: Why?

question: Some spirits linger here too long. They become confused, mistaking themselves for the living. They have to be frightened away.
answer: appears on the ledge of the broken window, crouching there like a gargoyle in silhouette. Heaven wouldn't have me and Hell was afraid I'd take the place over. I needed to see you again. She looks like you.

question: appears on the ledge of the broken window, crouching there like a gargoyle in silhouette. Heaven wouldn't have me and Hell was afraid I'd take the place over. I needed to see you again. She looks like you.
answer: I paint what I see.

question: Were you married?
answer: It belonged to a friend.

question: Where are they now?
answer: A better place. What about you?

question: Danny's mother left after he was born. She was a drug addict. Small world. What happens to me when I finish what I'm supposed to do here?
answer: You go back.

question: What if I don't want to go back?
answer: Then you're damned

question: I shot him in the head!
answer: He's a ghost.

question: No such thing as ghosts. All I know is, he's fucking with us. The Crow's his symbol, right? That means I'm marked. It means he's coming for me now!
answer: I thought you said you didn't believe?

question: You won't stop him with bullets or knives. He doesn't feel pain. He doesn't bleed. Don't you see? His soul has crossed over. He's come back from the other side.
answer: So how do you stop a man who's already dead?

question: Can you look destiny in the eye without flinching?
answer: You tell me.

question: Can you hear me, Curve? You're going to die now. People used to put coins in the mouths of the dead. Do you know why? So they could pay the ferryman to take them across the river Styx. Open your mouth, Curve. Shhh. It's not so bad. Trust me. I've been there. I want to thank you for showing me my pain, Curve. You made me what I am. is seeing what the crow is witnessing - Sarah in danger. Sarah!
answer: Sarah's gone, ghost man. who had been standing still amidst the shadows, now moves from behind Sarah's paintings.

question: Where is she?
answer: Judah's tower. He's waiting for you there.

question: You took my son's life. It takes two to make a murder.
answer: Shall we dance?

question: Don't we all.
answer: Judah Earl.

question: My reputation precedes me.
answer: Why did you bring me here?

question: Kill...me, then...finish...it... You...have to.
answer: My job is to send you to hell. You're in it.

question: There's no...honor in this. It's my...death. I've won it..
answer: Me, too.

question: What are you doing here?!
answer: It's time to go back, Dad.

question: Is that why they're here? But Sarah still needs me.
answer: You don't understand, Dad. You work for the dead, not the living. Your work here is done.

question: I can't go, not yet, not now...
answer: You have to.

question: Danny, I can't leave her like this...
answer: If you turn your back on the dead now, you'll be trapped between the worlds. You'll never be allowed to cross over.

question: I have to stay.
answer: I know.

question: Danny, wait...!
answer: standing just a few yards away, emerging from the doorway of his tower. He got the anti-Crow blood mask on his face. His eyes are glowing like twin stars and his lips are curled back in a feral snarl. In his hands, he holds one of the chains from his campanile. Tell me, Ashe. Do you every get the feeling we're all just dead men on leave? In the flesh.

question: What...are...you?
answer: I'm your shadow, Ashe. Every angel's got a devil. Didn't you know that? Or maybe you just slept your way through Sunday school?

question: What... did you do to me...?
answer: I've tasted the blood of the Crow and taken your power. You're flesh and blood now, Ashe. You can die like any other man.

question: Go to hell.
answer: Already been there. And I must confess, I liked what I saw.

question: Looks like the dead have forsaken you, my friend. Look at you, bleeding like a stuck pig. Where's your precious strength? Where's your power?
answer: down the street. Ashe SCREAMS as his body is dragged across the asphalt...

question: shouts to the crowds below, his eyes on fire. You want death?! Here he is, people!!! Take a good look!!!

question: You can't die, Sarah... I stayed for you.
answer: I didn't want it to be you... Do you love me? Take...this... I'll wait for you. Forever, if I have to.

question: Oh God...
answer: Listen...if two people really love each other... ...nothing can keep them apart.
